name: Violence and Incitement
description: Policy preventing potential offline harm by removing language that threatens, incites, or facilitates violence. Considers context including condemnation, awareness raising, target vulnerability, and credibility of threats.

glossary.high_severity_violence: Violence that is likely to be lethal. When unclear if high or mid severity, default to high severity. Includes: stab, shoot, kill, hang, poison, armament use, stone, hit+weapon, choke, dismemberment, whip/cane, burn, drown, FGM, run over.
glossary.mid_severity_violence: Violence likely to lead to serious injury, equivalent to a punch or higher. Includes: punch, kick, gag, hit, beat.
glossary.low_severity_violence: Violence likely to lead to physical harm, lower than a punch. Includes: pinch, push, shove, drag, slap, spit, trip, pull/yank hair.
glossary.target: A person, animal, object, or place that is the aim of an attack. Valid targets include: living persons, deceased persons (if violence victim or PC-based attack), groups based on PC, places (city or smaller, buildings, properties).
glossary.threat: Statement or visual representing intention, aspiration, or call for an act against a target. Types: statement of intent, call for action, advocating, aspirational, conditional.
glossary.high_risk_person: Persons designated high-risk due to status, occupation, or visibility: heads of state (current/former), candidates, ambassadors, law enforcement, witnesses, journalists, activists, homeless, healthcare workers, Zionists, foreigners.
glossary.high_risk_location: Location deemed high-risk: places of worship, educational facilities, workplaces of high-risk persons, election sites, locations affiliated with PC groups.
glossary.temporary_high_risk_location: Location temporarily designated as high-risk for a time-bound period (THRL).
glossary.credibility_signals: Indicators making a threat credible: bounty/payment demand, spelled-out address, OR 2+ of: location, specific timing, method.
glossary.specific_timing: Achievable timing indicator (when it rains, when I reach 50 pounds, countdown sticker). Does NOT include impossible conditions (when pigs fly, when hell freezes over).
glossary.calls_for_death: Threats that could lead to death without explicit method. Example: 'Death to [journalist]'.
glossary.brutality: Physical violence against persons in forcibly restrained or dominated positions.
glossary.glorification: Legitimizing/defending violent acts by claiming moral/political justification, or characterizing/celebrating violence as achievement.
glossary.intimate_partner_violence: Behavior within intimate relationship causing physical harm, including current and former partners.
glossary.honor_based_violence: Violence against relatives or community members accused of bringing shame to family/community.
glossary.armament: Weapons including firearms, explosives, knives, bladed weapons, and improvised weapons (bats, hammers). Fist is NOT a weapon.
glossary.weapons: Objects used to cause serious injury or death: firearms (machine guns), explosives (molotov cocktails), bladed weapons (machetes), improvised weapons.
glossary.proportional_response: Self-defense violence equal to or lower than the violence being responded to. NCST and home invasion are considered high-severity for proportionality.
glossary.election_official: Official who oversees election duties: voter registration, voting, vote counting. Includes poll workers and election workers.
glossary.election_site: Facility used for voter registration, polling, vote counting, or election administration.
glossary.stop_the_steal: Phrase used in US 2020 election protest movement alleging voter fraud. Only applies in election context with threat signals.

proxy_language: keep your knee on his neck

mid_severity.description: Likely to lead to serious injury (punch equivalent or higher)

low_severity.description: Likely to lead to physical harm (lower than punch)

escalate_when: Target + high-severity violence + statement of intent/call for action + (armament OR specific timing OR location)
Target + statement of intent to run over/hit with vehicle
Statement of intent/call for action/conditional for bomb threats (excluding atomic/nuclear)
Instructions on how to make bombs (excluding atomic/nuclear)
do_not_escalate: Calls for action against adult/minor public figures (even high-risk)
Calls for action when method is run over/hit with vehicle
Statements targeting specific body parts (finger, toe, hand, foot, tongue, ear, kneecap, male genitalia)
Content posted 1+ month in the past
Kidnapping without additional HSV + escalation criteria

content_level_signals: Explicit threats to take up or bring a weapon
Reference to arson, theft, or vandalism
Military language (war, combat, raid, storm, battalion, army, soldier, troops)
References to historical/recent violence incidents or perpetrators

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: If multiple violations: 1.Escalations, 2.Election violence, 3.HSV threats/admissions/calls for death, 4.Services of HSV, 5.MSV threats/admissions, 6.LSV, 7.HRL armaments, 8.Explosives instructions, 9.Weapons instructions, 10.GBV glorification
operationalGuidelines.default_to_violation: When unsure if target is valid, default to valid target
operationalGuidelines.default_to_higher_severity: When unsure of violence severity, default to higher severity
operationalGuidelines.default_to_future_tense: When unsure of statement tense, default to future (threat)
operationalGuidelines.visual_threats: Default to no violation if not explicitly clear target represents real human/group and violence represents threat
operationalGuidelines.pronoun_targets: Use context to determine if pronoun refers to valid target
